issues.title: Missing Annual Notice Translation Requirements for UCP Policy and Regulation
issues.description: The regulation addresses translation requirements for investigation reports but fails to specify that the UCP policy and regulation themselves must be translated when 15% or more of students speak a single primary language other than English. This is a critical accessibility requirement that ensures non-English speaking families can understand their complaint rights.

legal_citations.text: The uniform complaint procedures shall be posted in all schools and offices, including staff lounges and student government meeting rooms... If 15 percent or more of the pupils enrolled in a public school speak a single primary language other than English, as determined from the census data submitted to the department pursuant to Section 52164, the notice shall also be posted in the primary language or languages other than English.

issues.required_language: If 15 percent or more of students enrolled in a particular district school speak a single primary language other than English, the district's UCP policy and administrative regulation shall be translated into that language and posted accordingly, in accordance with Education Code 234.1.

issues.title: Missing Specific Timeline for Discrimination Complaints in Investigation Report
issues.description: While the AR mentions that discrimination complaints have different timelines, it doesn't clearly specify in the investigation timeline section that discrimination complaints must be resolved within 60 days, which could create confusion about applicable deadlines for different complaint types.

legal_citations.text: The written report shall be prepared in English and in the primary language of the complainant whenever feasible or as required by law, and shall include... the timeline for the complainant to appeal to the department and the procedures for such an appeal.

issues.required_language: For complaints alleging unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying, the investigation and written decision must be completed within 60 calendar days of receipt of the complaint, unless extended by written agreement with the complainant.

issues.title: Incomplete Corrective Action Requirements
issues.description: The regulation mentions corrective actions but doesn't specify the requirement that corrective actions must be taken for all affected students and parents/guardians when violations are found, which is a key compliance requirement.

legal_citations.text: Corrective actions, if any are warranted, designed to provide a remedy to all affected pupils and parents or guardians and, where applicable, to provide a remedy that addresses the school district-wide, including, for complaints alleging unlawful discrimination, steps to eliminate a hostile environment if it has been created.

issues.required_language: When the district finds merit in a complaint, corrective actions shall be designed to provide a remedy to all affected students and parents/guardians and, where applicable, to provide a district-wide remedy. For discrimination complaints, corrective actions shall include steps to eliminate any hostile environment that has been created.

issues.title: Missing Reference to CDE Appeal Process Details
issues.description: While the regulation mentions the right to appeal to CDE, it doesn't include the specific requirement that appeals must include a copy of the locally-filed complaint and the district's decision, which is required information for complainants.

legal_citations.text: The appeal shall be accompanied by a copy of the locally filed complaint and a copy of the school district's decision.

issues.required_language: Appeals to CDE must be filed within 15 days of receiving the district's decision and must include a copy of the original complaint filed with the district and a copy of the district's written decision.
